instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: macbook 12 inch 2015, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> sudden dead
threads.message:
visually, there's no liquid damage..
<RESISTOR>R4750</RESISTOR> looks bad, but when i measure it, it still has 20v on ppdcin
i have ppbus g3h is 8.6v
but <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> is 20v, shouldnt it be 3.3v ? is the bad <RESISTOR>R4750</RESISTOR> causing it ?

threads.title: macbook 12 inch 2015, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> sudden dead
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H</SIGNAL>, so 20V is correct!
It powers up the <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> power supply.

Do you get all S3/S0 voltages?
However, I do not recommend to waste time on this board.
It will end with dead CPU, like all <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
You can try to reflow entire board, just for test.

threads.title: macbook 12 inch 2015, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> sudden dead
threads.message: How many amps? Sounds like CPU died like always
